resources.string: Unfortunately, a service error occurred and access to the GMS database is impossible.
"Clicking the \"Update GMS Flags\" button will take you to GitHub with the latest release "
Detected a critical state in Google Mobile Services (GMS)
The GMS Flags application has detected an unstable state in GMS due to multiple errors, which may lead to overheating and performance issues.
The only option to revert the changes is to delete the data of the Google Play Services app.\n\nRead all the side effects:

1. If you have a wearable device - resetting the gms data will unpair your Wear OS watches. To pair it again, you will have to reset the watches.\n2. All bank cards saved on the device will also be reset.\nRarely, but it may take a few resets to get back the old scheme"
After a reset, you will have to wait 15 minutes to a few hours for gms to create a new database.
Unfortunately, the change has brought many difficulties, we are working hard to solve this problem, but the result is unknown.
Google has recently changed the database scheme in Google Play services. Unfortunately, the new scheme is not yet supported by the \"GMS Flags\" app.
The GMS Flags app has detected that Google Mobile Services (GMS) is running unstably and causing many errors. This can lead to severe overheating, reduced performance, or a complete system failure!
The only solution is to reset GMS data. Click the \"Fix it\" button and then select \"Clear all data\".
BUT! Resetting GMS will result in resetting bank cards and wearable devices.
Notifications for GMS crashes and critical states
Setup is complete, GMS Flags is ready for use
The application cannot connect to the GMS database because it does not exist.
You may be using a custom GMS or custom software, which may causing problems.
